intro: Echeandia mirandae, commonly known as the Miranda's echeandia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and sometimes edible roots. The species is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
